patterns: If I do minors in cse , can i go for masters in Cse computer science?
What are govt. job opportunities for cse computer science students?
other than job what are the other options in cse
responses: Yes,you definitely can go for masters in a subject you have opted minors.A cse student go for software development.There are many opportunities like background programming, app designing, web designing.Comapnies like google and microsoft provide great opportunities and there is a vast area to learn.Learning never stops. As far government jobs are concerned there are several departments where software engineers are employed like DRDO, ECIL,BPCL and many more. So it has a great scope.

patterns: what is an average package for cse computer science student?

will i get placed  after 4 years from cse
what are the placement statistics of computer science cse
responses: The average package is about 12 to 14 lakh per annum for  a CSE student.THe oncampus placement rate is about 85 to 90 percent.Some of the renowned recruiters of final placements 2020 included HPCL, Microsoft, Amazon, Goldman Sachs, DE Shaw, Optum, Tonichi Insatsu, Robert Bosch, etc. The institute provides facilities and services in the form of training sessions and workshops to prepare students for the placement season.

patterns: Which language is more prefered C++ or java or python?
which programming language to start with
is C++/java/python the best to start as a beginner
responses: You can start with either python or cpp. Python is taught in first semester from basics but simultaneously keep doing c++ also yourself. cpp is best for competitive coding and also required for some computer science core courses in 3rd sem. Its basic will not be taught by college.

patterns: What are courses in dse data science?
What are core courses of dse data science?
What are discipline elective courses in dse data science?
Do we study artificial intelligence machine learning in dse data science?
What is dse data science all about
responses: DSE is an interdisciplinary field that uses specific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from many structured and unstructured data. It incorporates knowledge from Statistics, Computer Science and Mathematics and hence can tackle challenging application domain.                                                                                                                                                The core courses in DSE are Data handling and visualization ,Mathematical Foundations of Data Science I,Mathematical Foundations of Data Science II,Introduction to Data structures and Algorithms,Matrix Computations for Data Science,Information Security and Privacy,Computing for Data Science, Introduction to Statistical Learning,Optimization for Data Science

patterns: If I do minors in dse , can i go for masters in dse data science?
What are various government govt job opportunities for dse  data science students?
other than job what are the other options in dse data science
responses: DSE is a new branch and we haven't had a batch sit for placements or internships yet.1. The number of opportunities as mentioned earlier is HUGE. Almost all software companies also have openings for data science related roles. Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Amazon, Adobe, Uber, CERN, NASA, ISRO etc.2. Our students have done data science related internships at ISRO, Siemens, Hyperverge, Japanese companies.3. We believe that the opportunities will be more or less similar to CSE.

patterns: What is Bioengineering?
What is the difference between bioengineering and biotechnology?
Is bioengineering is same as biotech?
how bio engineering is different from biotech?
responses: Bioengineering integrates physical, chemical, mathematical, computational and life sciences with core engineering principles driving the technologies towards advances and applications in health, environment, agriculture, energy etc thereby improving the quality of life. It creates knowledge from the molecular to organ systems levels, develops materials, devices, systems, information approaches, technology management, and methods for assessment and evaluation of technology, for the biological applications. The discipline of bioengineering has evolved drastically over the past 50 years, seemingly encompassing all fields that include bioelectric phenomena, bioinformatics, biomaterials, biomechanics, bioinstrumentation, biosensors, biosignal processing, biotechnology, computational biology, medical imaging, etc. The B.Tech and M.Tech dual degree programme on Bioengineering strives to train the students in the field of physical, chemical, mathematical and biological sciences together with engineering principles for inculcating knowledge enabling them in developing and deploying Bioengineering technologies in various fields.

patterns: What is electrical engineering?
Name a few subdisciplines of electrical engineering
What do I need to do as an Electrical Engineer?
responses: Electrical engineering is an engineering discipline concerned with the study, design and application of equipment, devices and systems which use electricity, electronics, and electromagnetism. It emerged as an identifiable occupation in the latter half of the 19th century after commercialization of the electric telegraph, the telephone, and electrical power generation, distribution and use.electrical engineering can be divided into four main branches: electric power and machinery, electronics, communications and control, and computers.

patterns: What is the difference between electrical and electronics engineering?
How is electrical and electronics engineering different?
Is electrical and electronics engineering the same?
responses: Electrical Engineering is different from Electronics Engineering. Electrical engineering deals with distribution and transmission of electrical energy ,electrical machinery,generation problems,motors and it's controlling. Electronics Engineering refers to the semiconductor devices and their connection on the integrated circuits and the printed circuit boards.

patterns: What is civil engineering?
What do I need to do as a civil engineer?
responses: Civil engineering is a vast field of engineering encompassing almost every aspect of human lives. From buildings design to water treatment civil engineers are everywhere. These few examples illustrate that civil engineers do a lot more than design buildings and bridges. They can be found in the aerospace industry, designing jetliners and space stations; in the automotive industry, perfecting the load-carrying capacity of a chassis and improving the crashworthiness of bumpers and doors; and they can be found in the ship-building industry, the power industry, and many other industries wherever constructed facilities are involved. And they plan and oversee the construction of these facilities as construction managers.

patterns: How and where is exodia organised
what is Exodia
what about technical and cultural fest?
How is our cultural fest?
responses: IIT Mandi, one of the pearls in the splendid tiaras of The Great Himalayas, hereby takes a stride to add to the shimmer of the gorge by bringing forth its Techno-Cultural festival ‘’EXODIA’’ which is back with a bang!! , and to endorse your presence as a delight, we will make sure that you’ll see more marvels this time. Exodia-reflects the Godly powers, the inexorable… in short the watchword of IIT Mandi. Exodia also happens to be one of the biggest college festival of northern india. This is your chance to immerse yourself into a huge variety of informative and lively events, showcases of cutting-edge technology, motivational speeches, and skill-sharpening workshops, specifically designed to present an exhilarating fusion of Technology and Culture, right at the HEART OF THE HIMALAYAS

through what way we can reach IIT mandi?
responses: Reach Delhi/Chandigarh whichever is convenient to you, by whatever means is convenient to you, and then take a bus (HRTC or private) from Delhi / Chandigarh to Mandi. Then institute bus from mandi to campus.

patterns: How many canteens are there in campus?
How many canteens are there in north campus?
How many canteens are there in south campus?
What is the total number of canteens in IIT Mandi?
Are there any night canteens?
responses: In-campus Dining: 2 central mess in South Campus and 2 central mess in North Campus (for hot meals throughout the year), Bakery, Canteen and 2 cafeterias are the places available for dining in the main campus.

patterns: how many mess are there in north campus?
How many mess are there in south campus?
total mess number in campus
common mess for girls and boys?
responses: There are common mess for boys and girls. 2 mess in north campus 2 in South campus. we can choose any.

patterns: Is there any gym in north campus?
Is there any gym in south campus?
How many  gyms are there in campus?
Do we have a gym trainer ?
responses: We have a gym in both south and north campus. Basically weight training centre is there

patterns: What is the distance between north and south campus?
What is the distance between north campus and Mandi ?
What is distance between south campus and Mandi?
responses: Distance between Mandi - South campus - 14KM ;Mandi - North - 19KM ; South - Campus - 5KM

patterns: What are the various buildings available in north campus?

responses: Hostel Mess Academic Gymkhana Faculty housing sports complex Health Centre

patterns: How many hostels are there in north campus?
How many hostels are there in south campus?
How many total hostels are there in the campus?
Are the hostels in campus co-ed?
Are there separate hostels for boys and girls?
responses: We have separate hostels for girls and boys. There are several girls and boys hostels, which house the undergraduate and postgraduate students. Faculty quarters are available for all faculty members. There are a few staff staff quarters as well. There are also studio apartments and guest houses for visitors. The campus is a fully residential complex for students, faculty, staff and visitors.

patterns: What is mode of travel cycle requirement within campus?
How to travel from north to south campus? bicycle required?
Are personal motor-vehicles allowed in the campus?
How to move about within the campus?
responses: Cycles are not required to commute in campus. You can borrow from MTB club if you want to go cycling with your partner. Motor bikes are not allowed in the campus

patterns: Are the weekends off ?
Do we have classes during weekends?
Do we have any fixed class schedule for weekends as well?
Can we have extra classes at weekends?
Do we perform practicals during weekends ?
responses: there are no classes during weekend but it can sometimes happen if there is a non scheduled holiday during weekdays since 1 credit accounts to 14 lecture classes which needs to be accomplished.

patterns: Is library available in North Campus?

responses: Central Library is situated in North Campus(newly built) and library is there in south campus also. To get info about timings and book borrowing system visit http://library.iitmandi.ac.in/

patterns: Who can use the Guest house of IIT Mandi?

What are the charges of using the guest house?
What price anyone have to pay to use the guest house at IIT Mandi?
responses: Guest house can be used by students and their families. Student can book them through oas online some days beforehand. The charges per night are 700 + 200(for one extra person). for more information checkout https://www.iitmandi.ac.in/Visitor_info/visitors/Notification_guesthouse_charges_27_6_2017.pdf

patterns: Which sports playgrounds are available in the campus?

responses: We are well equipped with playground and equipments for Basketball, Cricket, Volleyball, Soccer, Hockey, Football, Badminton, Tennis, Table Tennis and Cycling are few sports being practiced in the main campus. Activities like Hiking and Trekking are encouraged under guidance. https://gymkhana.iitmandi.co.in/sports.html

patterns: Does it snow in the campus?
is the weather too cold at campus?
What kind of weather is there in the campus?
Does it rain more or less often in the campus?
responses: Snow was last seen in feb 2019 when whole campus was covered with white dust. Its snows very rarely. The last time before 2019 it was 2014. Though every year you can witness some light snowflakes in early feb.

patterns: Is the campus area all plain or the terrain is quite rough?
Is the campus too hilly and round?
responses: The campus has three levels of terrain. Highest One has academic buildings and middle one has hostels and lowest one has faculty houses.

patterns: What is the capacity or size of each classroom?
How big are classroom?
responses: There are various classrooms in IIT Mandi. Some are big enough to accomodate 300 people and some are smaller to accomodate only 40 people. They are spacious and ventilated

patterns: Do we have seperate area or rooms for different club activities?

are there any common rooms
responses: There are seperate rooms for clubs (gymkhana club). Seperate rooms are also attached with hostel with TT Table foosball TV etc.

patterns: Is there any residential area within the campus?

responses: near the campus there are villages with very less population (for kamand its 205). You will have to go to Mandi main city to see more residences.

responses: There is a swimming Sports complex, North campus which is non - functional currently

patterns: How is delivery service in IIT Mandi?
does Amazon and Flipkart directly deliver stuff to campus
is food delivery available
are zomato and swiggy available
responses: Almost all the companies like amazon, flipkart deliver at campus. In fact, they deliver it to one's room. There is a common delivery point as well from where on can collect recieved goods. Though Swiggy and Zomato are not available.

patterns: What are all the other food courts available within our campus
what cafe are there in campus
are there any restaurants in or near campus
any cafeteria or restaurants located near campus
responses:
One Bite Restaurant is located in North Campus close to C.V. Raman Guest House South Campus
Daily Dose Restaurant is located in South Campus below the Maple Mess.
Treat Restaurant is located outside the south campus on the main road, this is a private restaurant which students from IIT Mandi often visit for parties and/or normal lunches and dinners.
There are also similar places near North Campus.

responses: You can use any network but airtel and jio would work best.Yes you can get simcard from campus but it is available only for a short time once freshers come.

responses: 2 banks are there in the south campus - SBI and PNB

patterns: fees of 8 semesters
fees per semester
how to pay fees
fees through paytm accepted
responses: Fees per semester is around 1.25L with 1L tution fees and 25k hostel + mess fees.payment is done through net banking,neft,rtgs etc. for more info visit https://www.iitmandi.ac.in/academics/fees.php

patterns: which clothes to bring
how much clothes to bring
winter summer clothes requirement
responses: Bring plenty of clother for both summer and winter. A jacket is enough to sustain the winter chill till early december since after that we have holidays.

patterns: is there any auditorium theatre in campus

responses: there is a single auditrium and an open air theatre.Capacity of audi is more than 600 and OAT is around 1000 when stuffed in.

games at iit mandi
responses: Physical education and sports section, IIT Mandi, coordinates all the sports activities and gives special attention to interested students by providing them with well-experienced coaches and adequate facilities. To know more about it visit https://wiki.iitmandi.co.in/p/Sports_Society

patterns: Do we have specialised coaches for all sports and games?

responses: We do have separate coaches for all sports.

patterns: what if a student does not perform satisfactorily in the academics?
what if a student does not perform satisfactorily in the academics?
What if a student fails in an examination?
Do we have to repeat the semester if we fail to pass the exams?
responses: A student will be placed on Warning if, in any semester, any two of the following conditions hold  s/he fails to secure at least 15 credits ii. his/her SGPA is less than 5.0 iii. his/her CGPA is less than 5.0 During the term of the Warning, a student will not run for or hold any office concerning any student activity. Academic ProbationA student will be placed on Academic Probation if, at the conclusion of any semester, s/he attracts a second consecutive Warning or if any two of the following conditions hold:  i. s/he fails to secure at least 12 credits ii. his/her SGPA is less than 4.0 iii. his/her CGPA is less than 4.0

responses: IIT Mandi provides flexible branch changing provisions,the interested candidates can refer to the link provided-  https://iitmandi.ac.in/academics/branch_change.php?fbclid=IwAR0l45njdypwLgpzsjJ64wQ1if2XhK3pvle9dYIUVXjuioQuw2NRZ9qkfZk

patterns: what is the semester exchange program all about?
Which colleges are we allowed to choose for semester exchange program?
How many students can go for semester exchange?
Do we have international colleges as well for semester exchange program?
responses: Students apply in their 4th semester for visit one of the international partners for 1-semester in their 5th, 6th, or 7th semester. 1.Students need to have >= 8.0 CGPA (~ 7.95+ maybe allowed in exceptional cases) 2.Students apply to an advertisement for semester exchange from IR and merit is created based upon student preference as well as their rank among applicants. 3.There are branch-wise seats in proportion to the applicants from each branch. 4.Students are exempt from semester fee at the foreign university but they need to pay for their boarding and lodging expenses – some expenses may be offset via a bank loan and/or semester abroad internship

patterns: what is the criteria for getting a degree of btech hons?
what is the criteria for getting a degree of btech honors?
What score do i need to maintain for getting an honours degree?
Will I get the honours degree if I fail in an examination?
responses: a. A student may opt for B.Tech. (Honors) programme if she/he has CGPA of 8.5 or more and no ‘F’ grade till fourth or fifth semester.b. For B. Tech (Honors), a student needs to earn additional 12 credits (over and above the required 160 credits for B. Tech degree) relevant to her/his discipline as recommended by the faculty advisor.c. Student should do ISTP & MTP compulsorily and obtain a grade of ‘B’ or above in both.d. Student should not have received ‘F’ grade throughout the B.Tech. program.e. Student should secure an overall CGPA of 8.5 or more out of 172 credits (160+12).

patterns: what is interactive socio-technical practicum?
What are facilities for socio-technical practicum?
What is ISTP?
responses: ISTP is intended to  1.Sensitize students with the problems around them in society. 2. Develop a sense of responsibility by being the solution provider. 3.Nurture the qualities required to become an excellent engineer or  technocrat who contributes to society in a variety of ways.Interactive Socio-Technical Practicum (ISTP) (3rd year) Examples of ISTP Projects 4.Watershed Management Techniques in Hilly Areas  5.Development of Educational Practical Kits/Tools for School Going Students 6.Bus Tracking Solution for the State of Himachal Pradesh 7.Eco-Tourism in Himachal Pradesh 8.Face-lifting Mandi (providing solution to congestion and traffic problems in Mandi town)  9.Food Waste Management

patterns: what is design practicum?
Explain design practicum?
what is the infrastructure and facilities for design practicum?
what is DP?
responses: Design Practicum (2nd year) 1.Random, inter-disciplinary teams of six members 2.Each project gets financial support upto Rs. 30 K 4.Each  team  is monitored  by  a  group  of  faculty (inter-schools). 5.Assessment is largely based on demonstration of working prototype in open house.Salient featuresObjectivesDesign a system, component, or process to meet desired needs  within  realistic  constraints  such  as  economics, environmental,  social,  health  and  safety,  manufacturability and sustainability.

patterns: what is reverse engineering?
What is reverse engineering course all about?
What do we learn in reverse engineering?
responses: Reverse Engineering (1st year) 1.Random, inter-disciplinary teams  2.Study existing products, eg. Fan, toaster, ... 3.Disassemble and document its design 4.Reassemble

patterns: how is cgpa and sgpa calculated?
What is cgpa?
What is sgpa?
Formula to calculate Cgpa?
What is difference between cgpa and sgpa?
responses: The performance in a semester is indicated by the Semester Grade Point Average (SGPA), which is a weighted average of the grades in all the courses done  by the student in the given semester. CGPA represents Cumulative Grade Point Averagefor all the semesters completed by the student.  The SGPA / CGPA is calculated as follows: SGPA / CGPA Calculation where ci  stands  for  the  credit  in  a  course  and gi  the  point equivalent of the grade obtained in that course.  The summation is over the number of courses n in the  semester.

patterns: discuss the grading system
what is grading system
How much do i need to score for securing an O grade?
Is the grading system relative?
responses: Grading is done on a 10-point scale by means of letter grades: O, A, B, C, D, E, F.  On the 10-point scale, these letter grades carry the following numerical values:Letter Grade:              O          A             B             C             D             E              FPoints equivalence:    10         9              8              7             6            4              0Where F grade is fail grade.In addition to these, there is a temporary grade, I (Incomplete). The I-grade indicates that a small part of the total requirements of the course remains to be completed and that the student has done satisfactory work in all other aspects of the course. Also certain courses are Pass/Fail (P/F) courses

responses:
If you are talking about if there are nearby coaching centres or special classes for this, then there isn't afaik.

 Our alumni's performance is commendable in upsc, with Athar Amir Khan sir who scored AIR 2 in 2016 and recently someone got AIR < 200. So no need to worry.
